description: Given a string representing the url for NY Times Today's, you must write a python script using the BeautifulSoup and requests modules to scrap all the headlines of that page.
text: Response.json is now a callable and not a property of a response.

description: Given a string representing the url for NY Times Today's, you must write a python script using the BeautifulSoup and requests modules to scrap all the headlines of that page.
text: The Session API has changed.

description: Given a string representing the url for NY Times Today's, you must write a python script using the BeautifulSoup and requests modules to scrap all the headlines of that page.
text: Sessions objects no longer take parameters.

description: Given a string representing the url for NY Times Today's, you must write a python script using the BeautifulSoup and requests modules to scrap all the headlines of that page.
text: Session is also now capitalized, but it can still be instantiated with a lowercase session for backwards compatibility.

description: Given a string representing the url for NY Times Today's, you must write a python script using the BeautifulSoup and requests modules to scrap all the headlines of that page.
text: All request hooks have been removed except ` response'.

description: Given a string representing the url for NY Times Today's, you must write a python script using the BeautifulSoup and requests modules to scrap all the headlines of that page.
text: Authentication helpers have been broken out into separate modules.

description: Given a string representing the url for NY Times Today's, you must write a python script using the BeautifulSoup and requests modules to scrap all the headlines of that page.
text: The parameter for streaming requests was changed from prefetch to stream and the logic was inverted.

description: Given a string representing the url for NY Times Today's, you must write a python script using the BeautifulSoup and requests modules to scrap all the headlines of that page.
text: In addition, stream is now required for raw response reading.

description: Given a string representing the url for NY Times Today's, you must write a python script using the BeautifulSoup and requests modules to scrap all the headlines of that page.
text: The config parameter to the requests method has been removed.

description: Given a string representing the url for NY Times Today's, you must write a python script using the BeautifulSoup and requests modules to scrap all the headlines of that page.
text: Some of these options are now configured on a Session such as keep-alive and maximum number of redirects.

description: Given a string representing the url for NY Times Today's, you must write a python script using the BeautifulSoup and requests modules to scrap all the headlines of that page.
text: The verbosity option should be handled by configuring logging.

description: Given a string representing the url for NY Times Today's, you must write a python script using the BeautifulSoup and requests modules to scrap all the headlines of that page.
text: One key difference that has nothing to do with the API is a change in the license from the ISC license to the Apache 2.0 license.

description: Given a string representing the url for NY Times Today's, you must write a python script using the BeautifulSoup and requests modules to scrap all the headlines of that page.

description: Given a string representing the url for NY Times Today's, you must write a python script using the BeautifulSoup and requests modules to scrap all the headlines of that page.

description: Given a string representing the url for NY Times Today's, you must write a python script using the BeautifulSoup and requests modules to scrap all the headlines of that page.
text: In addition, an invalid URL escape sequence now raises a subclass of RequestException rather than a ValueError.

description: Given a string representing the url for NY Times Today's, you must write a python script using the BeautifulSoup and requests modules to scrap all the headlines of that page.
text: Lastly, httplib.IncompleteRead exceptions caused by incorrect chunked encoding will now raise a Requests ChunkedEncodingError instead.
